oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Program, The Nashville Community Playhouse, presentation of “Rain,” 1946-1947 Season
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Nashville Community Playhouse program for a theatrical production of “Rain,” by John Colton and Clemence Randolph, founded on W. Somerset Maugham’s Story, “Miss Thompson,” presented during the 1946-47 season. The production was directed by Raymond Johnson; Setting by Hayden B. Johnson; Lighting by Bill Adler; Detailed set painting by Frank Suiter, and Costumes by Brook’s, New York. The Cast consisted of Kate Wells, Tommy Glover, Emily Glover, Gene Sullivan, Charles Wallace, Richard C. Dunn, Al Margolin, and Catherine Winnia. The Nashville Community Playhouse was known for its excellence in the arts, located at 2102 Belcourt Avenue. The play, “Rain,” was presented January 15th-22nd, 1947. Forms part of the Wilhelmina Webb Collection. 1 program.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Raymond
